Gandhi highlighted a striking example: a single photograph appearing multiple times with different names and details, claiming it belonged to a 'Brazilian model' used as a stock image for fraudulent entries. This accusation comes just before the Bihar polls.

Relief and rescue operations are underway, with authorities investigating the incident.

This has jeopardised the lives of dozens of patients. The government now needs to act decisively and without delay to operationalize funding mechanisms

title: Hidden health risks and side effects of chai and toast explained
description: Your beloved morning chai and toast might be silently impacting your health. Research indicates that daily consumption of refined carbs and sugary drinks can increase the risk of insulin resistance and metabolic syndrome. Simple swaps to whole grains, reduced sugar, and healthier toppings can transform this comfort food into a nourishing start.

title: Google may soon phase out Assistant, making Gemini the only option
“He wouldn’t have wanted the weepy bhajans”: Ratna Pathak Shah remembers Satish Shah
description:
Actor Ratna Pathak Shah pays tribute to friend and co-actor Satish Shah, talks of why there could have been no better way to say ‘goodbye’ to him than to sing his favourite songs. “He wouldn’t have wanted the weepy bhajans,” she says, even as she laments that the film-makers didn’t see Satish Shah’s talent beyond the comic roles. While opening up about the iconic chemistry in the landmark sitcom ‘Sarabhai VS Sarabhai’, she feels agitated about the underutilised talent of late actor Satish Shah.

“None of the directors at that time had the eyes to see Satish Shah’s talent. They were as bad as the commercial directors they dissed,” she says. Ratna Pathak Shah, in this exclusive interview, speaks on why good comedy is not being made in the country, and how it was a loss for the country to not see Satish Shah beyond his comical roles.

Presentation: Vinaya Deshpande 
Editing: Tayyab Hussain S M
Video: Emmanual Yogini

Kaur, who fulfilled a childhood dream, shared her emotional journey and encouraged aspiring cricketers to never stop dreaming.

description: Police in Faridabad are on the hunt for a 30-year-old man named Jatin Mangla, accused of shooting a 17-year-old student in Ballabgarh. The troubling case unfolded over several months with reports of stalking and harassment towards the victim. Despite attempts at reconciliation by the girl’s family, Mangla's violent actions escalated, leading to a confrontation that resulted in gunfire.

title: Platform friction: Amazon warns Perplexity over its Comet browser; asks to stop bots
description: Amazon has issued a cease-and-desist to Perplexity AI over its Comet browser agent making purchases. Amazon alleges fraud and terms violations, claiming Comet degrades the shopping experience and creates privacy risks. Perplexity counters, accusing Amazon of anti-competitive behavior and protecting its ad revenue, marking a significant clash over autonomous AI agents.

title: Man, waiting on road after van breaks down, killed by truck in Bengaluru
Andhra ashram school headmistress suspended for making students massage her legs
description: An in-charge headmistress at a tribal ashram school in Andhra Pradesh was suspended after a video surfaced showing students massaging her legs. The incident, which occurred about 10 days prior, sparked outrage and led to immediate action by authorities. A senior lawyer condemned the act as misconduct and exploitation of children.

title: It can be very expensive: Indian student in NYC shares experience
description: Indian students are increasingly drawn to New York City for creative studies, with Parsons student Anishka Tewari highlighting the city as a dynamic classroom. While facing challenges like high costs and homesickness, students gain invaluable real-world experience, learn from diverse global perspectives, and develop strong personal resilience, making the demanding journey a significant life lesson beyond design.

title: After $12.6 billion Amazon stake cut, Jeff Bezos' ex-wife MacKenzie Scott makes one of her biggest donations
description: MacKenzie Scott has gifted Howard University a remarkable $80 million, one of its largest donations ever, bolstering diversity and equity initiatives. This substantial, unrestricted contribution will aid student aid, infrastructure, and operations, arriving at a crucial time for the institution. Scott's ongoing philanthropic spree includes significant gifts to other DEI causes and a reduction in her Amazon holdings.

title: Vedant Birla–Tejal Kulkarni wedding: Urvashi Rautela & celebs bless newlyweds
description: Vedant Birla, son of industrialist Yashovardhan (Yash) Birla and Avanti Birla, tied the knot with Tejal Kulkarni, daughter of Sanjeev and Supriya Kulkarni, on November 2 in an intimate ceremony attended by close family members and friends.The couple later hosted a lavish wedding reception which saw the presence of several Bollywood celebrities, industrialists, and politicians who came together to bless the couple.
